title: Blended Teaching Method Design for Remote Language Learning: Strengthening Preservice Teachersâ€™ Socio-Cultural Competency and Citizenship

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital device proficiency, elementary understanding of the target language, basic awareness of multicultural education, and foundational comprehension of sociocultural diversity
context.additional_context: Targeting pre-service/in-service teachers, this course strengthens language competencies required for teaching roles, applying blended learning methods optimized for learners over 40 in technology-constrained environments. It emphasizes instructional design considering local historical/geographical characteristics and intergenerational cultural differences, including activities to enhance intercultural understanding among learners.

learning_goals: Learners explain language learning material adaptation strategies in remote environments and present real-classroom application cases considering cultural contexts, linked to sociohistorical backgrounds.

Learners improve writing and speaking proficiency in the target language through LMS-based asynchronous activities, develop communication strategies among multicultural learners, and explore citizenship development plans based on local community characteristics.

Learners design one blended teaching method (online/offline parallel) application case through a 4-week project-based assessment, produce a 5-minute presentation (PPT or video), and achieve at least 4 points per item (16+ out of 20 total) in peer/teacher evaluation rubrics (5 items: content organization, creativity, feasibility, cultural appropriateness, citizenship reflection).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
